Mathematics is often seen as totally abstract, so also as not having any ethical dimension. In this session, we will consider whether that is really true. We will look at the ethics of who gets to participate in mathematics (and who is excluded), the ethics of applying mathematics, and the kinds of ethical dilemmas that can appear in mathematics.
